main event: A civilian observed an inverted V-shaped object with several colored lights in Kirksville, Missouri on January 20, 1967.
interesting points: The object was smaller than a one-story house but larger than an automobile, and was lighted by steady, solid, white lights as well as red, gold, green, and silver lights.
The object appeared to have lights shining from it towards the ground, and the predominant light was red, illuminating the observer's automobile and surrounding street.
The object moved slowly on a horizontal plane, traveling north and then circling to the west, with the observer following in the same direction.
The observer became frightened and left the scene, and the object was not observed disappearing.
The sighting lasted between 5 and 10 minutes, and the observer was described as a reliable 50-year-old pre-kindergarten teacher with a Masters degree in Education.
sighted object: inverted V-shaped object with colored lights
